items.title: Pakistan Taliban claim responsibility for deadly terror attack in Islamabad
items.standfirst: Defence minister says country is in ‘state of war’ after suicide blast kills 12 and injures 27 outside court buildingsAt least 12 people have been killed in a suicide blast in Islamabad carried out by the Pakistan Taliban, as the country’s defence minister said a deadly surge in terror attacks had put the country in a “state of war”.The explosion, which was confirmed as a suicide attack by several government ministers, took place outside district court buildings in the capital on Tuesday at about 12.30pm. The area is usually heavily crowded with lawyers and litigants attending trials. Continue reading...

The area is usually heavily crowded with lawyers and litigants attending trials. Continue reading...

items.title: Israel bill to allow death penalty for 'terrorists' passes first vote in parliament
items.standfirst: A bill proposing the death penalty for "terrorists" passed a first reading in Israel's parliament on Monday (November 10)-- a measure that could apply to Palestinians convicted of deadly attacks against Israelis.
items.content: A bill proposing the death penalty for "terrorists" passed a first reading in Israel's parliament on Monday (November 10)-- a measure that could apply to Palestinians convicted of deadly attacks against Israelis.

ai_summary: The Israeli parliament advanced a bill proposing the death penalty.
The bill targets Palestinians convicted of deadly attacks.
The measure passed its first reading in the Israeli parliament.
The bill could apply to Palestinians convicted of terrorism.
The bill is an amendment to existing Israeli law.

items.content: The Turkish Football Federation has suspended over 1,000 players amid a growing investigation into betting.

The investigation concerns a widening betting scandal.
The Turkish Football Federation is conducting the investigation.
The federation's president called it a "moral crisis".
The investigation is focused on illegal betting activities.

clusters.title: Ukraine's anti-corruption bureau probes large-scale energy sector scheme
clusters.neutral_headline: Ukraine Investigates Alleged Corruption in Energy Sector
bullet_summary: Ukraine's anti-corruption bureau said it was investigating the country's energy sector on Monday (November 10), alleging a $100 million kickback scheme involving the state nuclear power company
Reported by France24, Guardian Business

items.title: Ukraine's anti-corruption bureau probes large-scale energy sector scheme
items.standfirst: Ukraine's anti-corruption bureau said it was investigating the country's energy sector on Monday (November 10), alleging a $100 million kickback scheme involving the state nuclear power company. For more analysis on that topic, FRANCE 24's Yinka Oyetade is joined by Daria Kaleniuk, Executive director of the Anticorruption Action Centre.
items.content: Ukraine's anti-corruption bureau said it was investigating the country's energy sector on Monday (November 10), alleging a $100 million kickback scheme involving the state nuclear power company. For more analysis on that topic, FRANCE 24's Yinka Oyetade is joined by Daria Kaleniuk, Executive director of the Anticorruption Action Centre.

items.title: Ukraine's anti-graft agency investigates alleged corruption in energy sector
items.standfirst: Ukraine's anti-corruption bureau said it was investigating the country's energy sector on Monday (November 10), alleging a $100 million kickback scheme involving the state nuclear power company.
items.content: Ukraine's anti-corruption bureau said it was investigating the country's energy sector on Monday (November 10), alleging a $100 million kickback scheme involving the state nuclear power company.

items.title: Ukraine’s energy sector faces wide-scale investigation over ‘kickback’ allegations
items.standfirst: Anti-corruption agency says state nuclear power operator Energoatom taking illicit payments of 10-15%Ukraine’s anti-corruption bureau said on Monday that it was conducting a large-scale investigation into the country’s energy sector, alleging kickbacks in transactions involving the state nuclear power operator, Energoatom.The bureau, which operates independently of the government, alleged that several senior figures were involved. Ukrainian media identified one of them as Timur Mindich, a businessman and associate of Ukraine’s president, Volodymyr Zelenskyy. Continue reading...
items.content: Anti-corruption agency says state nuclear power operator Energoatom taking illicit payments of 10-15%Ukraine’s anti-corruption bureau said on Monday that it was conducting a large-scale investigation into the country’s energy sector, alleging kickbacks in transactions involving the state nuclear power operator, Energoatom.The bureau, which operates independently of the government, alleged that several senior figures were involved. Ukrainian media identified one of them as Timur Mindich, a businessman and associate of Ukraine’s president, Volodymyr Zelenskyy. Continue reading...

ai_summary: Ukraine's anti-corruption bureau is investigating the energy sector.
The investigation alleges a $100 million kickback scheme.
The scheme allegedly involves the state nuclear power company.
Several senior figures are reportedly involved in the scheme.
The anti-corruption bureau operates independently of the government.

clusters.title: Turkish prosecutor seeks 2,352-year term for jailed opposition mayor Imamoglu
clusters.neutral_headline: Turkish Prosecutor Seeks Lengthy Prison Term for Istanbul Mayor
bullet_summary: Turkish prosecutors on Tuesday charged Istanbul’s jailed opposition mayor Ekrem Imamoglu with 142 charges that could amount to up to 2,352 in prison, court documents showed
Reported by France24, Guardian World

items.title: Turkish prosecutor seeks 2,352-year term for jailed opposition mayor Imamoglu
items.standfirst: Turkish prosecutors on Tuesday charged Istanbul’s jailed opposition mayor Ekrem Imamoglu with 142 charges that could amount to up to 2,352 in prison, court documents showed. The nearly 4,000-page indictment charges Imamoglu, who was arrested in March, with offences including running a criminal organisation, bribery, embezzlement, money laundering, extortion and tender rigging.
items.content: Turkish prosecutors on Tuesday charged Istanbul’s jailed opposition mayor Ekrem Imamoglu with 142 charges that could amount to up to 2,352 in prison, court documents showed. The nearly 4,000-page indictment charges Imamoglu, who was arrested in March, with offences including running a criminal organisation, bribery, embezzlement, money laundering, extortion and tender rigging.

items.title: ‘Entirely political’: Istanbul mayor charged with 142 offences that could total 2,000 years in jail
items.standfirst: Ekrem İmamoğlu, the main political rival of Recep Tayyip Erdoğan, faces charges including bribery and extortionTurkish prosecutors have charged Istanbul’s jailed mayor, Ekrem İmamoğlu, with 142 offences that could carry a penalty of hundreds of years in prison, in a move seen as a politically motivated attack on the country’s opposition.The indictment filed on Tuesday, which runs to nearly 4,000 pages, charges the popular opposition figure who was arrested on 19 March with offences including running a criminal organisation, bribery, embezzlement, money laundering, extortion and tender rigging. Continue reading...
items.content: Ekrem İmamoğlu, the main political rival of Recep Tayyip Erdoğan, faces charges including bribery and extortionTurkish prosecutors have charged Istanbul’s jailed mayor, Ekrem İmamoğlu, with 142 offences that could carry a penalty of hundreds of years in prison, in a move seen as a politically motivated attack on the country’s opposition.The indictment filed on Tuesday, which runs to nearly 4,000 pages, charges the popular opposition figure who was arrested on 19 March with offences including running a criminal organisation, bribery, embezzlement, money laundering, extortion and tender rigging. Continue reading...

ai_summary: Turkish prosecutors charged Istanbul's mayor with 142 offenses.
The charges could result in a prison sentence of 2,352 years.
The mayor, Ekrem Imamoglu, is a political rival of Erdogan.
The indictment is nearly 4,000 pages long, according to reports.
Imamoglu was arrested in March and is currently jailed.

clusters.title: TikTok influencer killed in public ‘execution’ as Mali’s jihadist crisis worsens
clusters.neutral_headline: TikTok Influencer Publicly Executed in Mali by Suspected Jihadists
bullet_summary: Armed men in Mali have abducted and publicly executed a TikTok influencer who posted videos in support of the West African nation's military, local authorities have said
Reported by Guardian World, Sky News World

items.title: TikTok influencer killed in public ‘execution’ as Mali’s jihadist crisis worsens
items.standfirst: Mariam Cissé, who posted videos in support of ruling junta, received death threats before being abducted and killedA TikTok influencer has been shot dead in front of a crowd by suspected jihadists in Mali, underlining how state control has been eroded in the west African nation.Mariam Cissé often wore combat attire to post videos in support of the country’s military to more than 100,000 followers on TikTok. According to Yehia Tandina, the mayor of Timbuktu region, she was abducted in a market on Friday by unknown gunmen. Continue reading...
items.content: Mariam Cissé, who posted videos in support of ruling junta, received death threats before being abducted and killedA TikTok influencer has been shot dead in front of a crowd by suspected jihadists in Mali, underlining how state control has been eroded in the west African nation.Mariam Cissé often wore combat attire to post videos in support of the country’s military to more than 100,000 followers on TikTok. According to Yehia Tandina, the mayor of Timbuktu region, she was abducted in a market on Friday by unknown gunmen. Continue reading...

items.title: TikTok influencer publicly executed in Mali
items.standfirst: Armed men in Mali have abducted and publicly executed a TikTok influencer who posted videos in support of the West African nation's military, local authorities have said.
items.content: Armed men in Mali have abducted and publicly executed a TikTok influencer who posted videos in support of the West African nation's military, local authorities have said.

ai_summary: A TikTok influencer was publicly executed in Mali.
The influencer posted videos supporting the military.
The execution was carried out by suspected jihadists.
The influencer was abducted in a market in Timbuktu.
The incident highlights the erosion of state control.
